newsitem.title: UK: UK's Major says no plausible case for leaving EU.
newsitem.headline: UK's Major says no plausible case for leaving EU.

text.p: Prime Minister John Major said on Tuesday there was no good reason for Britain to leave the European Union.

Speaking at the first of a series of presidential-style news conferences, he said: "I don't believe when you examine the implications of leaving the European Union that there is any remotely plausible case to be made for leaving."

Major has been under pressure from "Eurosceptics" in his ruling Conservative party opposed to closer European integration to distance Britain from Brussels or even leave the bloc altogether. -- London newsroom + 44 171 5427947
